document.template:
conf t

interface GigabitEthernet1
    no ip flow monitor itential-monitor input
interface GigabitEthernet1.33
    no ip flow monitor itential-monitor input
no snmp-server community kentikSNMP RO 
no sampler itential-sampler
no flow monitor itential-monitor
no flow exporter itential-exporter
no flow record itential-flow
document.name: IOS-XE Flow Config - Reset - Kentik - Example

document.name: AWS Blocked Traffic Event - Allowed List Error

steps.template:
An alert has been captured in Kentik about a blocked Security Group (${securityGroupName}) for the Web Server.
  • ${kentikURLName0}
  • ${kentikURL1Name}
  • Itential Job
  • IP Source: ${ipSource}
  • IP Destination: ${ipDestination}
  • AS Source: ${asSource}
However, the auto remediation request was ignored since the source IP is not part of the allowed IP List:
    ${allowedIPList}

[code]An alert has been captured in Kentik about a blocked Security Group (${securityGroupName}) for the Web Server.
  • ${kentikURLName0}
  • ${kentikURL1Name}
  • Itential Job
  • IP Source: ${ipSource}
  • IP Destination: ${ipDestination}
  • AS Source: ${asSource}
[/code]

An alert has been captured in Kentik about a blocked Security Group (${securityGroupName}) for the Web Server.
  • ${kentikURLName0}
  • ${kentikURL1Name}
  • Itential Job
  • ServiceNow Change Request
  • IP Source: ${ipSource}
  • IP Destination: ${ipDestination}
  • AS Source: ${asSource}

${renderedTeamsMessage}
An automated attempt to remediate the problem will now occur.

${renderedTeamsMessage}
Remediation Successful! Security Group has been altered to authorize ingress traffic.

${renderedTeamsMessage}
Remediation Failed! Security Group already includes source IP.
ServiceNow Incident Opened: ServiceNow Incident

  • Itential Job
  • ServiceNow Change Request
  • Kentik
